New Records: This was France's first Euro 2024 round of 16 game without extra time, and Belgium also didn't play any extra time in this year's Euros.
Key Match Events: Kolo Muani scored the winning goal for France after a deflection by Belgium defender Jan Vertonghen.
France won the match 1-0, marking their third consecutive victory against Belgium in major tournaments.
The match was France's first game in the Euro 2024 knockout stage, and they avoided a penalty shootout.
Belgium's journey in the tournament ended with a heartbreaking own goal.
The game was France's eighth win and sixth draw in their last 15 Euro matches against Belgium.
Pre-Game Insights: France and Belgium had a long-standing rivalry with France dominating most encounters, including a 5-0 win in the 1984 Euros.
France had scored only two goals in their Euro 2024 group stage, the fewest in a major tournament since 2010.
Belgium had won their last four Euro round of 16 games, showing their consistency in knockout stages.
Post-Match Reflections: France defender Jules Koundé was named Player of the Match for his strong defense and key contributions.
Belgium coach Roberto Martínez expressed disappointment over the own goal, calling it a tough result for his team.
France's journey to the quarter-finals was celebrated, while Belgium's exit was met with sadness.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was the 76th meeting between France and Belgium, with France having a strong historical dominance.
France had not lost to Belgium in a Euro match since 1984, making this victory significant.
Others: The match started at 5pm Nigerian time, with live updates provided throughout.
France and Belgium both had strong teams, but France capitalized on their chances effectively.
